p: The first COVID-19 case appeared with a delay of more than one month on 30 January 2020 [ 18]. The total number of confirmed cases for India was 198,706 within a population of around 1.4 billion [ 18]. A total of 5598 fatal cases were reported until 2 June 2020 [ 18]. The COVID-19 outbreak was controlled firmly until beginning of April 2020, however, incidence thereafter began to increase. The curve currently shows an upward trend in fatalities and a peak is not yet visible in Figure 10. A lack of awareness and a relaxed attitude has resulted in an increase in COVID-19 cases and fatalities [ 56]. The situation in India is far from over and strict regulations should continue, paired with mask-wearing strategies, nationwide testing, and control of overcrowded indoor environments.
